content.introduction:
Detect dangling references in value handles like 
std::string_view
.
These dangling references can be a result of constructing handles from
temporary values, where the temporary is destroyed soon after the handle
is created.

Examples:

string_view
 
View
 
=
 
string
();
  
// View will dangle.


string
 
A
;


View
 
=
 
A
 
+
 
"A"
;
  
// still dangle.



vector
<
string_view
>
 
V
;


V
.
push_back
(
string
());
  
// V[0] is dangling.


V
.
resize
(
3
,
 
string
());
  
// V[1] and V[2] will also dangle.



string_view
 
f
()
 
{


  
// All these return values will dangle.


  
return
 
string
();


  
string
 
S
;


  
return
 
S
;


  
char
 
Array
[
10
]{};


  
return
 
Array
;


}



span
<
int
>
 
g
()
 
{


  
array
<
int
,
 
1
>
 
V
;


  
return
 
{
V
};


  
int
 
Array
[
10
]{};


  
return
 
{
Array
};


}
